subject: a question for electronics brains
author: trilobitegal
full_text: I recently bought an RS 20-125.  I tried to hack it, and did successfully cut the MU wire without clipping the wires on either side.  However, some of the wires in the gray ribbon detached at a point near the glue at the end of the ribbon.  My question for you all is: should I buy a small soldering iron and try to reconnect these wires?  And - does current pass through solder, so that I'd only need to attach the two ends with solder, and not have to twist the wires together (which would be impossible for me)?  Thanks so much for any ideas!
